article.headline: Holy Cross 66, Fordham 57
article.story: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) -- Keith Simmons scored 12 points, leading four Holy Cross players in double figures, as the Crusaders beat Fordham 66-57 on Wednesday night. Jave Meade and John Hurley scored 11 points each and Nate Lufkin added 10 for Holy Cross (3-4), which snapped a four-game losing streak. Michael Haynes had 11 points, eight rebounds and five assists for Fordham (2-4). Mushon Ya'akosi added 11 points. Fordham led 34-33 at the half, as Jermaine Anderson sparked the Rams with nine first-half points. But Simmons keyed a 23-9 second-half rally as the Crusaders pulled away. Simmons scored six points and Lufkin added four as Holy Cross outscored Fordham 11-4 to take a 50-42 lead with 12:38 left. The Crusaders then capitalized on inside play, pushing the lead to 62-47 with 6:17 left as Lufkin and Kevin Hyland each scored 4 points. Holy Cross had a 38-25 edge in rebounds and forced 19 Fordham turnovers, including 10 in the decisive run.
